image.altText: A map of Australia against a background of orange and purple stripes.

items.synopsis: Australia has voted No in the referendum, but the vote hasn't been uniform across states and cities. A small number of electorates, mainly in inner cities, are projected to have voted Yes.

title.children: A clear pattern has emerged in the way cities have voted in this referendum

image.altText: Signs for Yes and No seen at a voting centre in Brisbane.

items.synopsis: A No vote is recorded nationally and in all six states as the Voice to Parliament proposal is defeated in Australia's first referendum this century. Look back on all the results in our blog.

title.children: Australians vote against a Voice to Parliament with every state returning a No vote — as it happened

image.altText: Anthony Albanese frowns during a press conference.

items.synopsis: Australians have rejected recognising Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people as the nation's first people in the constitution through the establishment of a Voice to Parliament advisory body.

title.children: PM says Australia must do better for first peoples as Voice referendum voted down

image.altText: A pile of referendum ballot papers being counted

items.synopsis: Antony Green projects a majority No vote nationally and in four states. Our full results guide breaks down the numbers.

title.children: Voice referendum results: Follow the count across the country

image.altText: The back of a woman with a vest saying Australian Official on it

items.synopsis: Repatriation flights that were scheduled to evacuate Australians out of Israel this weekend have been cancelled, as residents in Gaza City scramble to leave in anticipation of a ground invasion.

title.children: Repatriation flights cancelled for Australians as Israel deadline for Gaza evacuations passes — as it happened

image.altText: A close up shot shows Luxon with a huge smile in front of National branding

items.synopsis: New Zealand has voted for change, with the National Party claiming a resounding victory over Labour and sending first-term MP Christopher Luxon to the prime minister's office.

title.children: NZ elects Christopher Luxon as PM as blue wave crashes across country

image.altText: Barnaby Joyce, Michaelia Cash and Bridget McKenzie sitting in front of protesters at the national press club

items.synopsis: As Australians hit the polls to have their say in the Indigenous Voice to Parliament referendum, here's a look back — in pictures — at how we got here.

title.children: In pictures: The Indigenous Voice to Parliament debate of 2023

image.altText: Scoot plane wing seen from an airport terminal

items.synopsis: The man allegedly told a cabin crew member "I have a bomb", forcing the flight from Singapore to turn back under fighter jet escort.

title.children: Australian man charged after alleged bomb threat on Perth-bound flight

image.altText: Three posters with photographs of people and the words 'bring them home'

items.synopsis: A week after Hamas terrorists' brutal attack on Israel, up to 150 kidnap victims remain in Gaza. Experts on hostage negotiation and terrorism say the world now faces several difficult choices.

title.children: The world's never seen a hostage crisis quite like this. Here's how it could play out

image.altText: A woman, a man and two young children look at the camera, surrounded by luggage and other people

items.synopsis: Tal Raymond, Dana Elhadad and their two young children were among the first Australians at Tel Aviv's Ben Gurion Airport for a Qantas repatriation flight on Friday, but not all of them got on board.

title.children: 'Hardest decision I've ever had to make': Aussie families torn apart at Tel Aviv airport

image.altText: A firefighter stares down a blaze

items.synopsis: Fellow crew members tried to help a volunteer firefighter with a defibrillator until ambulance officers arrived but the man died in what RFS Commissioner Rob Rogers says was the "ultimate sacrifice".

title.children: Volunteer firefighter dies after medical episode while tackling NSW fire

image.altText: Virgin, Qantas planes

items.synopsis: Some of the recommendations of a new report would shift power away from Qantas — such as by giving travellers automatic cash compensation for delayed or cancelled flights, write Gui Lohmann and Justin Wastnage.

title.children: Qantas won't like it, but Australian travellers could be about to get a better deal on flights

image.altText: Sam Clipperton celebrates on Think About It

items.synopsis: Think About It wins the $20 million Everest at Randwick, beating I Wish I Win and Private Eye in the world's richest thoroughbred race on turf.

title.children: 'Unbelievable' Think About It wins $20 million Everest at Randwick

items.synopsis: As the votes are cast and counted, our expert panel featuring Antony Green will bring you live updates of the count, looking at state-wide and regional trends.

title.children: Watch our live video coverage of the Voice Referendum vote count.

image.altText: A woman holding her baby standing in front of a school building

items.synopsis: Western Australians were still lining up to cast their votes for more than an hour and a half after the national result was known – here’s how that played out.

title.children: Western Australians learn of Voice referendum defeat while waiting in line to vote

image.altText: A woman holding a large handbag and wearing a scarf who looks wealthy walks the street.

items.synopsis: There was a time when the name of one whistleblower was on everyone's lips. Kathy Jackson was lauded as a "revolutionary" — but in the shadows was another person waiting to blow the whistle on her.

title.children: The man who blew the whistle on whistleblower Kathy Jackson and revealed her as a fraud

image.altText: A woman sobs as people stand against a sandstone wall at a funeral

items.synopsis: Israel is preparing to carry out a ground operation with a mission to "destroy Hamas". But what then? What is the political reality and make-up of Gaza and what would it look like without Hamas, asks John Lyons.

title.children: A reeling Israel is on the brink of razing Gaza – and the outlook is grim

image.altText: Palestinians drive down a road on motorbikes, cars, tractors and utility trucks

items.synopsis: Thousands of Palestinians flee to southern Gaza in search of refuge after Israel warns them to leave before an expected ground offensive against Hamas in retaliation for the deadliest attack in Israel's history.

title.children: Hamas accused of using Gaza residents as a 'shield' as Israeli ground invasion looms

image.altText: Victoria Beckham and David Beckham pose for a photo, wearing suits, in front of a Netflix media wall

items.synopsis: The Posh and Becks story is a distortion of the Cinderella legend, as triumph isn't the result of noblesse oblige, of being selected, but the result of middle class striving that Britain has long struggled to understand, writes Virginia Trioli.

title.children: In their distorted Cinderella legend, the Beckhams get the last laugh

image.altText: Sensors sit next to a tablet with weather information

items.synopsis: Queensland researchers launch a project to develop an in-home early warning system for elderly residents during extreme heat.

title.children: Heat kills more people in Australia than any other natural disasters. These researchers are looking at a simple solution

image.altText: Long purple petals opening up from the yellow centre of a flower.

items.synopsis: Indigenous horticulturalists have taken 21 cuttings of the first known purple Banksia spinulosa. But it remains to be seen whether they will flower, and what colour the petals will be.

title.children: Discovery of 'one in a billion' native plant sparks hope for more purple flowers

image.altText: Costa, who has long hair and a bushy beard, smiles against a blue backdrop, with images of a cheese toastie and kimchi.

items.synopsis: If we're being honest, Costa's known for one thing: the delightfully enormous beard covering half his face. We sat down with the Gardening Australia host to find out if his big beard really is full of secrets.

title.children: Eating burgers with a knife and fork and even killing houseplants: Costa reveals his darkest secrets

image.altText: Tim Tszyu looks to one side

items.synopsis: Tim Tszyu and Brian Mendoza both make weight ahead of their WBO super welterweight world title fight on the Gold Coast. Here's all you need to know about the latest world title contest to take place in Australia.

title.children: 'I want to chase glory:' Tim Tszyu chases last hurrah in Australia at weigh-in for Brian Mendoza world title fight

image.altText: A young woman gazes at a magenta flower

items.synopsis: When Lauren Bouyer tries to conjure an image in her mind's eye, nothing happens. Researchers say her condition, aphantasia, is more prevalent than previously thought.

title.children: Loren can't 'see' things in her imagination. It's more common than you might think

image.altText: An older man stands in water. He has a white towel around his waist and no shirt. he has tanned skin and some wrinkles. He frown

items.synopsis: Longtime regulars at Pelican Point on Lake Bonney, a designated clothing-optional beach, are frustrated over a lack of access following major floods and joint-management wrangling.

title.children: Naturists 'completely locked out' of South Australian nude beach

image.altText: Jade Ellenger celebrates

items.synopsis: Brisbane kicked eight goals to down the Suns at Carrara and win the QClash. St Kilda have extended their AFLW winning streak to a club-record four games by defeating Greater Western Sydney, Geelong beats Fremantle, Essendon beats Richmond and Hawthorn power past Sydney.

title.children: Brisbane hammers Gold Coast in AFLW QClash

image.altText: A range of old cars in a car museum.

items.synopsis: Experts believe the future of vehicles will include a mix of technologies as the planet becomes more environmentally conscious.

title.children: As the world becomes more environmentally conscious, what does this mean for classic and prestige car lovers?

image.altText: West Indies batter Stafanie Taylor walks off the field as Australia fielders celebrate.

items.synopsis: After rain stopped them taking a commanding 2-0 lead over West Indies in their ODI series, Australia is trying to wrap up the three-game series with another big win. Check out the live scores and stats in our ScoreCentre.

title.children: Australia coasts to easy win in final ODI against West Indies

image.altText: A Cruise driverless taxi in San Francisco

items.synopsis: A recent Californian trial saw self-driving taxis crash into a fire truck and get bogged in wet cement. Such incidents erode trust in the technology, writes autonomous systems researcher Zena Assaad.

title.children: San Francisco's driverless taxis marked a new era in transportation. Then the problems started

image.altText: composite of fire truck for western australia fire service, people at a beach side pool in sydney and people skiing in perisher

items.synopsis: A quick glance at the national forecast this weekend and you could be forgiven for questioning what season we're in. ABC meteorologist Tom Saunders explains what is driving the country's weather disparity.

title.children: Heat in the west and snow in the south-east — here's what is driving Australia's stark weather contrasts
